Name: Word
Third Dolch: Sentences

Name: about
Third Dolch: Tell me about your day.^I read a book about animals.^We talked about the game.

Name: better
Third Dolch: She feels better now.^I want to do better.^It is better to wait.

Name: bring
Third Dolch: Please bring your bag.^He will bring a gift.^Can you bring some water?

Name: carry
Third Dolch: Carry the box carefully.^She can carry the bag.^He helps carry the toys.

Name: clean
Third Dolch: Please clean your room.^She will clean the table.^I like to keep things clean.

Name: cut
Third Dolch: Cut the paper carefully.^He cut his sandwich.^She can cut the ribbon.

Name: done
Third Dolch: Are you done with your work?^I am done eating.^He has done his homework.

Name: draw
Third Dolch: Draw a picture.^She likes to draw.^I can draw a cat.

Name: drink
Third Dolch: Can I have a drink?^She likes to drink water.^He drank his juice.

Name: eight
Third Dolch: I have eight pencils.^She saw eight birds.^We need eight chairs.

Name: fall
Third Dolch: The leaves fall in autumn.^Be careful not to fall.^He saw the ball fall.

Name: far
Third Dolch: We live far away.^The hill is far.^How far can you run?

Name: full
Third Dolch: The cup is full.^She is full after lunch.^The basket is full of apples.

Name: got
Third Dolch: I got a gift.^He got a new toy.^She got a surprise.

Name: grow
Third Dolch: Plants grow fast.^He wants to grow flowers.^I like to grow vegetables.

Name: hold
Third Dolch: Hold my hand.^She can hold the baby.^He holds the book tightly.

Name: hot
Third Dolch: The soup is hot.^It is hot outside.^Be careful

Name: hurt
Third Dolch: My arm hurts.^She fell and it hurt.^He hurt his foot.

Name: if
Third Dolch: If it rains
column3: we stay inside.^Tell me if you need help.^I will go if I can.

Name: keep
Third Dolch: Keep your hands clean.^She keeps her room tidy.^Please keep it safe.

Name: kind
Third Dolch: Be kind to others.^She is very kind.^He did a kind thing.

Name: laugh
Third Dolch: We laugh at jokes.^She likes to laugh.^They laugh together.

Name: light
Third Dolch: Turn on the light.^The room is full of light.^She carried a light bag.

Name: long
Third Dolch: The road is long.^He has long hair.^It was a long day.

Name: much
Third Dolch: How much do you want?^She doesnâ€™t have much time.^I love you so much.

Name: myself
Third Dolch: I can do it myself.^I made it myself.^She looked at herself.

Name: never
Third Dolch: I never lie.^He never eats candy.^She said never again.

Name: only
Third Dolch: This is the only one.^I am the only child.^We have only two cookies.

Name: own
Third Dolch: She has her own book.^I want my own toy.^He built his own house.

Name: pick
Third Dolch: Pick a flower.^Can you pick a number?^She picked a red apple.

Name: seven
Third Dolch: I have seven marbles.^She saw seven birds.^We need seven chairs.

Name: shall
Third Dolch: Shall we play?^I shall go now.^Shall we start the game?

Name: show
Third Dolch: Please show me.^She will show her drawing.^He showed us the way.

Name: six
Third Dolch: I have six pencils.^She saw six birds.^We need six chairs.

Name: small
Third Dolch: The dog is small.^She has a small bag.^I saw a small bird.

Name: start
Third Dolch: We start school at nine.^She will start the game.^I will start my homework.

Name: ten
Third Dolch: I have ten apples.^She counted ten birds.^We need ten chairs.

Name: today
Third Dolch: Today is sunny.^I will play today.^She is happy today.

Name: together
Third Dolch: We work together.^They played together.^We walked together.

Name: try
Third Dolch: Try again.^I will try my best.^She tries to help.

Name: warm
Third Dolch: The blanket is warm.^It is warm outside.^He feels warm and cozy.
